page.title: 02INTRODUCTION SWANAGE
page.content: The days when Swanage was noted for its building and contracting firms which employed 100's of skilled men are sadly gone. The industry now employs few and farming even fewer. The discovery of considerable resources of oil nearby, and the expansion of the ball clay industry give some scope for employment but this is limited as far as Swanage is concerned. It is hoped that the pier will be brought back into use, together with a marina for better yachting facilities. The dedicated work of the railway enthusiasts are creating an undoubted attraction for a large body of visitors. This goes to show that the future of the town lies squarely in tourism now and even more in the future.
